result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevon A Bush

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Notice of completion
Received and Filed. NOTICE OF RETAINER

Adjustment Number: 22A 090298,
Payable Number: 1034003,
Receipt Number: 22RP038191,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Trevon A Bush in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Trevon A Bush. Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Trevon A Bush. Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared in court on behalf Annie Louk for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant requests substitution of counsel, due to reasons put forth on the record. Court grants request for substitution of attorney Sargent for attorney Toran. Court further informs attorney Toran that a notice of retainer has yet to be filed and orders him to do such. Defense counsel agrees, and requests a status conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Van Grunsven, Br. 9.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br. 16.

Defendant Trevon A Bush in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Trevon A Bush appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Menge. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Trevon A Bush in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Trevon A Bush in custody.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
